body:
Me either, and this isn't my idea. I just thought it'd be funny to prove almost everyone wrong.

But the "simple" explanation is, if you're in a car, you know from being outside that cars move, but observe that from inside the car, it is actually the world zooming past *you*; otherwise the movement would push you against the seat the same way someone outside getting hit with the car would, but instead you don't move or even feel the pressure to slide back. And even spills and dust and feathers fall straight down inside, proving that it is the world around you moving and the car remains stationary. But standing on the outside, it's clear that the car is the one moving, with the exact same test! Majority seems to rule and you accept that this is just an illusion, but it's actually not. It's simply two different perspectives. Any point you select to compare movement against will always be in the center, fixed and stationary, because it's literally your point of comparison. In fact, in programming when rendering 3D worlds you do not have any "camera" to move around, as it's always on screen; instead you *move the world itself*. The same applies to the earth and the sun. This is why we don't feel the earth moving or get thrown off of it, because from our own point of reference it's not moving at all. But if you stand on the sun, earth is moving around it and rotating.

But, the sun is the most convenient place to choose since it's the largest mass and therefore the ultimate driver of gravity and other forces for everything else in the solar system. So choosing the earth or anything else is indeed odd and doesn't make a whole lot of sense, but it isn't *wrong*.

Sorry but that's the simplest I could explain it with my limited male vocabulary. But motion *is* relative, and it's why scientists can't exactly determine how much earth (or anything) moves in the universe, as they don't really have a master object to pinpoint for the whole universe and compare us to. The lack of this proves motion is relative. Also the fact that earth, on top of the solar system, on top of the milky way "moves" very fast yet everything within our solar system does not fly past us, but remains completely in place as if it were stationary. Indeed, on its own it is stationary. In this article scientists were able to get a measurement of motion but had to resort to comparing us against what they believe to be the big bang, because there is no universal point of reference: https://www.forbes.com/sites/startswithabang/2016/04/01/how-fast-does-earth-move-through-the-universe/

post.body: And earth also still does revolve around the sun and spins and moves at the same time. This sounds complicated and contradictory but the explanation is simple. For any kind of movement you need a point of reference. Obviously that point will always be stationary with everything else moving in comparison to it. If that's the sun, then earth revolves around the sun and rotates, as does everything. However if it's earth, then the sun revolves around earth, as does everything. One isn't any more correct than the other, technically they're both true depending on what your point of reference is. The main star is simply the most logical choice because it's central to nearly all solar systems, and it's the simplest model with which to explain gravity and different forces that the star plays a major role in for all objects in the solar system. This is why we don't feel the earth spinning or moving through space, because our point of reference is ourselves, who are on earth, and therefore from our perspective the earth is geocentric. But if we were on the sun, it would be solarcentric. When you get on a merry-go-round, it doesn't move at all, the world around it does and you can only tell it's the merry-go-round that's moving because of wind and air resistance. But when you're in the outside world the merry-go-round moves and the world stays the same. There's no grand central point of space we're comparing anything to absolutely, it all depends on perspective, and we've chosen the sun because it's the best one to use for science.

body: See that's just the thing though, they *are* better for modern jobs because modern jobs depend more on brain than body, and women simply have superior brains to men. It's been scientifically proven that they use more of their brain and that they are more sophisticated in general, whereas men are more formulaic and simple-minded. Even though girls tend to go after "girly" interests and don't usually develop as many skills as boys outside of their particular hobbies (because society allows this assuming they will find a man to take care of them), the potential is there. Meanwhile, the boys *must* succeed or they will be punished, and they also have a bigger edge for competition and success. So as adults it seems like the boys are smarter, but in reality they just work more and are too over-represented to try and draw fair stats from the working population. Girls are proven to naturally have way more talent than boys in nearly every single subject, even math and science despite it being more of a boy thing that seems to scare girls away. Think back to ancient times when the woman needed to be taking care of and entertaining the child, while the man risked his life to go out hunting and fighting for his family and tribe. Obviously having a bright and happy mind is vital for the former role, whereas the latter doesn't take too much thought, just spatial and motor skills and aggression. This is why before entering the workforce the boys are usually seen in sports and roughhousing, while the girls do more art and music and get better grades. They simply have two different skillsets, boys physical/spatial and competitive and girls mental and social. This probably explains why 3x as many men commit suicide, as their mental health is not as much of a priority at a biological level, even though more women are diagnosed with depression and emotional disorders because they're better at expressing it (and also society sees it as normal in boys, because it is, and often punishes them for complaining about it while girls are encouraged to seek help for even the most minor struggles).

Thing is, I’ve had feminists tell me that women can do everything men can do only better my entire life.  I’ve had women fight kicking and screaming to get into the military, state jobs, police and fire fighting stating they did just as good of a job as men do. 

If this is true, they should be happy to end segregated sports altogether because women don’t need them. If this is not true, and men are going to dominate women’s sports to the point that no woman will ever win again then we need to get women out of jobs they don’t do as well in as men. If they can meet the MENS standard they can be in, if not fuck lowering the bar. 

I’m tired of leftists and feminists picking and choosing what parts of equality they want and which ones they don’t. Men in women’s sports is the inevitable conclusion of feminism.

post.body:
Also I'm adding #34: Biologically men are not designed to have content, happy, or enjoyable lives. Our sole purpose is as the provider and defender, and also sperm providers. We are basically incapable of feeling any emotion strongly except for anger and aggression, and this is our default. We have half the brain women do and are less smart as a result, not to mention almost zero creative ability; there are way more male "geniuses" but only because men are pressured to succeed while the women are allowed to be lazy because men have to do everything for them. The top IQ on record is from a woman, and brain scans have shown their cognitive abilities to be superior even though they are nowhere near as cultivated. And despite our role as the physical laborer and fighter, our pain tolerance is actually lower, because nature doesn't give a shit about us, only what we do for society. We are to toil in hard labor and risky, painful situations while everyone else reaps the benefits of it. And fail or even express the slightest discontentment about it, and society punishes you. As a man, your life is literally *supposed* to be miserable, both socially and biologically. Men are biologically stripped of any ability to feel content or happy. We are pawns and slaves, and no one cares about us. We die younger, suck at everything but athletics, are miserable all the time, and basically are slaves. Your life is destined to be miserable and you have to like it. Men have basically nothing good going for themselves. Nature gave men the rough end of the deal, with the exception of a few thousand years where they got jealous and oppressed the women, and that didn't help men, it just made women miserable too. At least we're not honey bees. No wonder "women have more depression" even though far more men kill themselves. Because everyone feels bad and sees it as a problem if a girl is depressed, but boys are *supposed* to feel that way and be miserable and just accept it.

Fuck off feminazis. You haven't the first clue about what male "privilege" is. None. Our lives are slavery, and even now that we have the opportunity for more for the first time, we still are biologically designed to be worthless slaves and rarely capable of anything else. You don't realize how much we have to pay just to be able to lap you on a track and be obligated to awful duties no one wants to do. It's not a fair trade, and guess what? You didn't get the rough end of deal, men did.

That's nice.

I honestly have no beef with you, but when it comes to people trying to destroy ones culture and family, no, I have no love for them. Do I pray they change and see the error of their ways? Absolutely. I'd they did change their ways and ask forgiveness would I forgive them? Yes. If they come to kill me or my family will I stand idly by and quote scripture while they do it? At some point, probably, when God puts it upon my heart to be martyred, but until then, no. As a husband and father I am tasked with providing and protecting my family and those in my care, and so long as evil people rule and do ungodly things I will hate them with a righteous hatred, and give them no quarter if it comes to a fight.

You may do what you will, of course, and if I am in the wrong I guess I'll find out at the Bema seat, but I don't believe I am.

Enjoy the rest of your day.

"Render unto Caesar that which is Caesar's but render unto God that which is God's."

parent.body:
Also nonsense. Am I to make it clear that I love a man I see stabbing others on the street? I may feel saddened that something in his life caused him to do this but I hate him for harming others and should give no quarter in doing whatever is necessary to stop him, even ending his life then and there, without question or concern. God told the Israelites to kill every man, woman and child of more than one opposing nation. Did he tell them to make sure they knew they were loved first? They were wicked people doing wicked things and God had them destroyed because of it using His people. I'm all for loving our enemies, but I seriously doubt this applies to someone who is attempting to enslave or kill you. I see no evidence of it in scripture beyond Christ, who did it to fulfill his purpose. If he had intended for us to do the same then why instruct the disciples to literally sell their clothes for a weapon?

I may pray that "our rulers" turn from wickedness and rule with wisdom, but the moment they promote wickedness and come after me and mine I hate them and will do what must be done to prevent those God has placed in my charge from harm. God hates these people!

Psalms 11:5
The Lord tests the righteous and the wicked,
*And the one who loves violence His soul hates.*

Hosea 9:15
All their wickedness is in Gilgal: *for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of mine house, I will love them no more*: all their princes are revolters.

body: The world itself is fucking awful. Nothing is fair and most people are doomed to misery their entire lives even if they do everything right. Better politics will make it slightly more tolerable but really it always still comes down to pure luck, and to be honest it's silly to think we're going to stop it and I think it's the wrong hill to die on (especially when God himself allows whatever happens to happen, and we are powerless unlike we want to think). The nihilists are right, there is absolutely no meaning or purpose at all in this world, it just is, read Ecclesiastes. It was never about this world and if it is that's a sign something's not right.

parent.body:
I don't agree. The founders were strong christians and they were so involved in politics they lead a rebellion against a tyrannical government and still remained strong christians. One of the reasons we are in the situation we are in now is because christians avoid politics far more than they should. Is our kingdom in heaven? Yes! But AFTER our time here on earth, and what kind of love do we show to allow the worlds children and future generations to suffer under communism and tyranny? A christian United States got involved in WW1 and WW2. If the cause is just, then christians should be there because our God is a god of truth, justice and even scales. We should hate wickedness, evil and sin. We should hate that certain people in our government are creating a wedge between a cohesive nation AND between the nation and Christ.

I can't get behind this, especially now when people are very vocal about their desire to reprogram citizens, take their children and place them in camps, with all seriousness. As christian men it is of great import that we protect our families, and that means being in the know and making wise decisions.

Also I'm adding #34: Biologically men are not designed to have content, happy, or enjoyable lives. Our sole purpose is as the provider and defender, and also sperm providers. We are basically incapable of feeling any emotion strongly except for anger and aggression, and this is our default. We have half the brain women do and are less smart as a result, not to mention almost zero creative ability; there are way more male "geniuses" but only because men are pressured to succeed while the women are allowed to be lazy because men have to do everything for them. The top IQ on record is from a woman, and brain scans have shown their cognitive abilities to be superior even though they are nowhere near as cultivated. And despite our role as the physical laborer and fighter, our pain tolerance is actually lower, because nature doesn't give a shit about us, only what we do for society. We are to toil in hard labor and risky, painful situations while everyone else reaps the benefits of it. And fail or even express the slightest discontentment about it, and society punishes you. As a man, your life is literally *supposed* to be miserable, both socially and biologically. Men are biologically stripped of any ability to feel content or happy. We are pawns and slaves, and no one cares about us. We die younger, suck at everything but athletics, are miserable all the time, and basically are slaves. Your life is destined to be miserable and you have to like it. Men have basically nothing good going for themselves. Nature gave men the rough end of the deal, with the exception of a few thousand years where they got jealous and oppressed the women, and that didn't help men, it just made women miserable too. At least we're not honey bees. No wonder "women have more depression" even though far more men kill themselves. Because everyone feels bad and sees it as a problem if a girl is depressed, but boys are *supposed* to feel that way and be miserable and just accept it.

Fuck off feminazis. You haven't the first clue about what male "privilege" is. None. Our lives are slavery, and even now that we have the opportunity for more for the first time, we still are biologically designed to be worthless slaves and rarely capable of anything else. You don't realize how much we have to pay just to be able to lap you on a track and be obligated to awful duties no one wants to do. It's not a fair trade, and guess what? You didn't get the rough end of deal, men did.

Just to feel miserable longer? Just to fail more? No wonder men kill themselves a lot (Disclaimer: I'm not killing myself, too many people care about me and I still have the off-chance of finding some reason to live).

body: Is it a crime? Of course not, it's not your fault. But it does suck. Not because you're male, but because biologically men are not designed with them in mind, only what they do for society, while women are designed to feel happy and content themselves and be more productive as unique individuals rather than pawns. So if you're a man you're pretty much destined for a shitty life, no matter how lucky you are. This is not the fault of attitude or socialization but actual differences in how their brains and bodies work. Basically nature does not care about men at all.

For memes and shitposting about everything that happens in our beloved "Official Ruqqus Discord"
 
---

## Posting Rules


Rule 1: 

This guild is for shitposting about people/events in the Ruqqus Discord server. Any post that is not related to this will be kicked to +general. If you need help regarding the discord server, +askruqqus, +general, or +hub would gladly accept your questions.


Rule 2:

No spamming. Spamming would be considered any of the following:

* Same-format posting within a day

* Same-content posting within a day (Same content, different format)


Spammed posts will get kicked and repeated offenses results in being exiled.


Rule 3: 

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.
